sub_topic: The chaotic dynamics of the Belousov-Zhabotinsky reaction
message_1: Assuming a Belousov-Zhabotinsky reaction has a concentration of malonic acid of 0.1 mol/L, and the reaction is taking place at a rate of 0.05 mol/L/min. After 10 minutes, what will be the concentration of malonic acid left in the reaction?
message_2:
To find the concentration of malonic acid left in the reaction after 10 minutes, we can use the following formula:

Final concentration = Initial concentration - (Reaction rate × Time)

Initial concentration of malonic acid = 0.1 mol/L
Reaction rate = 0.05 mol/L/min
Time = 10 minutes

Final concentration = 0.1 mol/L - (0.05 mol/L/min × 10 min)

Final concentration = 0.1 mol/L - (0.5 mol/L)

Final concentration = -0.4 mol/L

However, the concentration of a substance cannot be negative. This means that after 10 minutes, all the malonic acid has been consumed in the reaction, and the concentration of malonic acid left is 0 mol/L.
